definition: to cause havoc/to run amok
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
Monkey Wreaks Havoc in Heaven, story about the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] from the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记

sentences.english: We had a famous set-to at rat-hunting all the morning in my father's great barns;
sentences.chinese: 我們在我父親的大谷倉裏逮老鼠，大鬧了一個上午。

sentences.english: Yuxiang assumed Aishan has been seduced by Youli and created a commotion inside his house.
sentences.chinese: 玉香以爲愛善被有禮勾引到屋裏，衝到有禮家大鬧。

sentences.english: By Sunday morning, I was so angry with Dr.
sentences.chinese: 但是週日清晨，我對賀博士大鬧肝火，我想離開。

sentences.english: She had turned seriously nasty over a handsome yale boy .
sentences.chinese: 她爲了一個漂亮的耶魯大學生真的大鬧了一場。

sentences.english: When he finds out you broke his glass, he will raise the devil.
sentences.chinese: 一旦他發現你弄壞了他的玻璃杯，他準會大鬧一番。

sentences.english: On the other hand, Mingming's father creates trouble at Huixin's wedding ceremony, but is stopped by Shuibo.
sentences.chinese: 明明的父親又到蕙心的婚禮大鬧，卻被水波趕走。

sentences.english: Indeed as expected FengZeYuan havent open the door, a group of beggars make blocked the door.
sentences.chinese: 果然豐澤園還沒開門，一幫乞丐堵住門口大鬧。

sentences.english: Martian Body Count" opened this week! It's the prequel to "Doctor Decimator Atomizes Mars.
sentences.chinese: 火星威龍“這週上映是”博士殺人狂大鬧火星的前傳。

sentences.english: He wanted to return the insult, but bit his lips in order to avoid a scene.
sentences.chinese: 他本想回罵，但咬咬嘴脣以免當衆大鬧。

definition: to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to abuse roundly
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to set a trap
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
item (on a program)
to harbor hard feelings
to remain unmoved
to injure/to wound/to damage
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
depressed/sulky/moody/unhappy
conspiracy/secret plan/to conspire
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
